We summarise these results in the following Key Point:

Key Point

For any integers \(m\), \(n\), \[ \displaystyle{ \int _{-\pi}^\pi } \sin nt \cos mt \hspace{0.15cm} dt = 0 \]

\[ \displaystyle{ \int _{-\pi}^\pi } \sin nt \cos mt \hspace{0.15cm} dt = \begin{cases} 0 \hspace{1cm} n \neq m \\ \pi \hspace{1cm} n = m \neq 0 \\ 2\pi \hspace{0.8cm} n = m = 0 \end{cases} \]

\[ \displaystyle{ \int _{-\pi}^\pi } \sin nt \sin mt \hspace{0.15cm} dt = \begin{cases} 0 \hspace{1cm} n \neq m, \hspace{0.2cm} n = m = 0 \\ \pi \hspace{1cm} n = m \neq 0 \end{cases} \] All these results hold for any integration range of width \(2\pi\).
